NARRATOR: (OFFSCREEN) The tasks
and procedures of "housekeeping" for

36. MS. TEACHER REACTS
AS JANITOR ENTERS WITH
TV SET.
NARRATOR: (OFFSCREEN) When
television attempts to make its entrance
into the classroom. . . it is often viewed
from the perspective of teachers weary
of experimenting with new media. Not
too surprisingly, television may find
the classroom door shut in its face.
DISSOLVE TO
37. NARRATOR AT DESK.
NARRATOR: (SYNC) At the adminis-
trative level. . . television may trigger
another reaction. It may receive a "red
carpet"-uncritical. . . welcome. . . because
it is new, electronic, or because other
schools have it.
